title: Can I complete the factory reset on my Pixel 4 if the phone is unable to connect to my Wi-Fi?
content:
After installing a system update yesterday morning, my Pixel 4 stopped connecting to my WiFi.  I did all the troubleshooting and identified the problem was my phone. (Other devices are connected with no problem, and I took the phone to other locations where Wi-Fi is available and the same problem occurred.)
Multiple contacts with Google support led to a reset of my Wi-Fi and mobile connections, which unfortunately cut me off entirely from Google Fi and thus rendered my phone unworkable for calls/texts/mobile data via the network.  More contacts with Google support have led to repeated suggestions to do the same things which have not resolved the issue.
One suggestion was to to a factory reset, which I'm willing to do, but I'm concerned at the step that says to make sure you're connected to the internet.  Obviously I am not, since that prompted my service contact in the first place. 
Thus, my basic question: Can I do a factory reset if my phone is not not currently able to connect to an otherwise available Wi-Fi signal.?
I cannot believe how many repeated contacts I've had with Google support that have led me nowhere.  I've used both chat and email--no consistency and no resolution.
